snippet: Aetna, the big health insurer, also raised its earnings forecast for the full year, and Allstate, the home and auto insurer, returned to profitability.
abstract: Aetna and Allstate both report earnings that exceed Wall Street expectations; Aetna reports second-quarter net income of $457.6 million, or $1.32 a share, compared with $536.7 million, or $1.39 a share, a year earlier; quarterly revenue rose to $8.82 billion from $8.32 billion a year earlier; Allstate reports a net profit of $423 million, or 86 cents a share, in contrast to a $624 million loss in the same period a year earlier, or $1.19 a share; quarterly revenue rose to $8.28 billion, from $8.08 billion a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Aetna, the big health insurer, also raised its earnings forecast for the full year, and Allstate, the home and auto insurer, returned to profitability.

headline.main: Profit at Aetna and Allstate Tops Analysts’ Expectations
headline.print_headline: Profit at Aetna and Allstate Tops Analysts’ Expectations
